titleStmt.title: A glass for the people of New England, in which they may see themselves and spirits, and if not too late, repent and turn from their abominable ways and cursed contrivances that so the Lord God may turn away his wrath, which he will bring upon them, it they repent not, for their blasphemies against himself, and for all the murders and cruelties done to his tender people, ever since they usurped authority to banish, hang, whip, and cut off ears, and spoil the goods of dissenters from them in religious matters, while themselves disown infallibility in those things / by S. G.
titleStmt.author: S. G. (Samuel Groome), d. 1683.
Fox, George, 1624-1691.
Tyso, John, d. 1700.

notesStmt.note: "A secretly-printed Quaker tract, on the cruel action taken by the General Court of Massachusetts in 1643 against the Quakers, and Anne Hutchison." -- Pref. to the 1929 edition.

"Some tenents ... found ... in a book called, The elders tenents in the Bay," p. 24-28; "Queries ... for the New-England priests and elders to answer," signed: G. F[ox], p. 29-33; "The copy of a letter which was delivered into the hands of R. Bellingham ... for him to read and consider," dated and signed: the 15th of the 4th moneth, 1667. John Tyso, and other writings by Tyso, p. 34-43.
